Judul: A Modal Control based Fully Rated Converter for Damping Torsional Oscillations in Large Turbo-generators
Abstrak:
This paper introduces a new method for damping the
Sub-Synchronous Resonance (SSR) in electrical power systems.
The proposed technique is based on utilizing the main controllers
of Fully Rated Converter-based wind turbines (FRC-WTs). Two
auxiliary controllers are added to the main controllers of the
converter and designed to damp the unstable torsional oscillatory
modes. FRC-WTs is connected with the IEEE First Benchmark
system for SSR to perform the studies. The effectiveness of the
proposed controller on damping the unstable torsional oscillatory
modes over a wide range of series compensation is investigated.
MATLAB code is developed and used to perform frequency
domain analysis and the results are verified by digital timedomain
simulations. The present study shows that coordination
of the two main controllers, with added auxiliary signals, of the
FRC-WTs can significantly increase the electrical system
damping to the torsional oscillatory modes.
